title: TIER MER Processing R Script SOP
text: script developed run tierdrop package process TIER Data NDOH submission DATIM. article serve SOP utilize tierdrop package USAID South Africa’s MER Processing.

title: TIER MER Processing R Script SOP
text: install packages machine, need re-install unless necessary update package. case, let’s install tierdrop TIER processing package Github. package uses many functions R packages tidyverse OHA packages.

title: TIER MER Processing R Script SOP
text: Even though packages install, R session recognize packages load session. use library() function load necessary packages. Let’s load tierdrop package developed NDOH TIER processing, well tidyverse. installed tidyverse package yet, call install.packages("tidyverse") first.
code: library(tierdrop) library(tidyverse) #> Warning: package 'ggplot2' was built under R version 4.1.3 #> Warning: package 'tibble' was built under R version 4.1.3 #> Warning: package 'dplyr' was built under R version 4.1.3 #> Warning: package 'stringr' was built under R version 4.1.3

title: TIER MER Processing R Script SOP
text: Since many files live Google drive, like Master Facility list mapping files, need authenticate Google drive accounts R can pull directly files. also need setting DATIM credentials pull directly DATIM. can use glamr::set_email() function store email credentials R glamr::set_datim() function store DATIM credentials. , can load credentials workspace calling glamr::load_secrets().
code: #glamr::set_email("ksrikanth@usaid.gov") #CHANGE TO YOUR EMAIL ADDRESS #glamr::set_datim("ksrikanth") #CHANGE TO YOUR USERNAME glamr::load_secrets()

what: Step 4: Set up your folder directories and store some locals
title: TIER MER Processing R Script SOP
text: biggest benefit R package now, anyone USAID SA SI DMR team can use process TIER data. maximize collaboration reproducibility, want ensure folders appropriately set devices. Save latest NDOH file data-raw/NDOH folder Save recent site-level MSD Genie pull DATIM data-raw/MSD-Genie. , please pull Panorama DATIM genie hand. done saving files correct folders, enter 1 console continue action. also want save local objects call later current quarter period. Please amend manually now, still development automating step. Finally, want check make sure using correct files printing file path. correct, please revisit folder setup ensure correct files saved correct places.
code: #Set up folder directories dir_setup() #> [1] "The following directories will be created:" #> data-raw #> data-raw/NDOH #> data-raw/Reference Files #> data-raw/MSD-Genie #> data-raw/Import Files #> data-raw/Validation Files #> Please save the following files to the data-raw/NDOH folder: Latest NDOH File #> Please save the following files to the data-raw/Reference Files folder: Additional mechanism data for specific sites (if needed) #> Please save the following files to the data-raw/MSD-Genie folder: Most recent site-level MSD or data-pull from Genie #> When done, enter 1:  #set folderpaths ndoh_folderpath <- 'data-raw/NDOH' reference_folder <- "data-raw/Reference Files" msd_folder <- "data-raw/MSD-Genie" import_folder <- "data-raw/Import Files" validation_folder <- "data-raw/Validation Files" ndoh_filepath <- ndoh_folderpath %>% glamr::return_latest() msd_filepath <- msd_folder %>% glamr::return_latest()  #store some locals - change depending on the quarter fiscal_quarter <- "FY22Q3" curr_qtr <- "Q3" #do a quick check to make sure you have the file paths for NDOH and the MSD that you want: If not,  print(ndoh_filepath) #> [1] "data-raw/NDOH/MER Reporting FY22Q3 v2_010822.xlsx" print(msd_filepath) #> [1] "data-raw/MSD-Genie/MER_Structured_Datasets_Site_IM_FY20-23_20220617_v2_1_South Africa.zip"

previous_headings: Purpose: > Part B: Import helper data files (MFL, Genie Pull)
what: Step 5: Read in Master Facility List (MFL)
title: TIER MER Processing R Script SOP
text: going read Master Facility List (MFL) directly Google Drive using googlesheets4::read_sheets() function googlesheets4 package. also going import tidy version MFL using clean_mfl(), function tierdrop package, tidy version MFL can use join site-level data NDOH file. MFL later used TIER processing bring DSD/TA designation site reporting quarter. , also using head() function view first 10 rows clean MFL list. great way inspect data R.
code: #Load MFL as is mfl_new_df <- googlesheets4::read_sheet(mfl_new_id, sheet = "MFL")  #then grab the clean MFL df_fac <- clean_mfl() head(df_fac, 10) #> # A tibble: 10 x 6 #>    usaid_facility                     ou5uid      datim_~1 old_o~2 period DSD_TA #>    <chr>                              <chr>       <chr>    <chr>   <chr>  <chr>  #>  1 fs Kamohelo Clinic                 LAbNrhPgaQF eFfGa61~ 628551  FY22Q3 TA     #>  2 fs Lusaka Clinic                   MzPsnexqVSY t7ziJm4~ 862615  FY22Q3 TA     #>  3 fs Marantha Clinic                 bSqgtAJ0s3J DSHHKrA~ 577133  FY22Q3 TA     #>  4 fs Masilo Clinic                   JsGytRwj7vN nKLpWqz~ 762651  FY22Q3 TA     #>  5 fs Tshepong (Verkeerdevlei) Clinic ExeluDGbbUR BQGSONi~ 113042  FY22Q3 TA     #>  6 fs Winburg Clinic                  megs14LrEpu EnDbIkU~ 928015  FY22Q3 TA     #>  7 fs Winburg Hospital                kOj21dGIJA3 tmESQvQ~ 862315  FY22Q3 TA     #>  8 fs Allanridge Clinic               KWtUdeDAdhG AAqsP8M~ 734833  FY22Q3 TA     #>  9 fs AM Kruger Clinic                HA95VMbA6Zk tGJWb6s~ 853642  FY22Q3 TA     #> 10 fs Boithusong Clinic               qmYVEDE9NKi NTB5jSz~ 423942  FY22Q3 TA     #> # ... with abbreviated variable names 1: datim_uid, 2: old_ou5code

previous_headings: Purpose: > Part B: Import helper data files (MFL, Genie Pull)
what: Step 6: Read in the latest MSD or Genie pull
title: TIER MER Processing R Script SOP
text: set-, pulled latest MSD Panorama Genie saved data-raw/MSD-Genie folder. Now, going read , NDOH processing script calls previous quarters MSD tidying, well verification checks. going read MSD using helper packages developed OHA called glamr gophr, may easier work MER Structured Datasets R. Note - Since loading site-level MSD, section may take minutes load.
code: #read the most recent MSD from the Genie folder df_genie <- msd_folder %>%   glamr::return_latest() %>%   gophr::read_msd()

previous_headings: Purpose: > Part B: Import helper data files (MFL, Genie Pull)
what: Step 7: Pull down mechanism meta-data from DATIM
title: TIER MER Processing R Script SOP
text: Lastly, need pull mechanism data order map mech_code mechanism_uid facility NDOH. , connect DATIM API pull mechanism level data South Africa using tierdrop::pull_mech_uid(). allows us bring mechanism_uid information. Note - section may take minutes load well, virtue connect DATIM. Now, going use mechanism data DATIM join facility-level mech-data MSD, get list facilities reported DATIM fiscal year map corresponding mechanism data. , going use grab_mech_data() function tierdrop package. mech_df - mechanism dataframe got pull_mech_uid() .e. mechs msd_df - latest MSD dataframe loaded .e. df_genie extra_mechs - Sometimes, ’ll extra mechs encode manually - example, FY22Q3, two MATCH facilities DATIM yet, add manually. , select grab_mech_data(df, extra_mechs = TRUE) follow prompt ensure data saved correctly. call grab_mech_data(), prompted ensure additional files saved correct place. additional mechanism data adding manually, please ensure saved data-raw/Reference Files folder. file saved folder already, filenpath appear blue. -critical ensure additional mechanism file (used) 4 columns named exactly : - sitename - facilityuid - mech_code - prime_partner_name done saving files correct folders, enter 1 console continue action. Note - errors likely due file path naming issues
code: # Note - this may take a few minutes to pull in mechs <- pull_mech_uid(ou_sel = "South Africa") mech_df <- grab_mech_data(mech_df = mechs, msd_df = df_genie, extra_mechs = TRUE) #> Before continuing, please ensure that your additional mechanism data is saved #> in the `data-raw/Reference Files` folder with the following filepath: #> additional-mechdata-FY22Q3.xlsx (amend fiscal quarter as needed) #> Please include the following 4 variables: #> sitename #> facilityuid #> mech_code #> prime_partner_name #> When done, enter 1:

previous_headings: Purpose: > Part C: NDOH File Processing
what: Step 8: Process NDOH File and convert into import file for DATIM
title: TIER MER Processing R Script SOP
text: Now dependencies helper files set , can start process NDOH data! tierdrop package, function called ndoh_processing runs code process, tidy, prepare NDOH file DATIM import file. ’ve set one-line function can run, training also give peek behind curtain helper functions. filepath = recent NDOH filepath qtr = current quarter (format Q_ ex: “Q3”) export_type = type format want export : (1) Import file format (2) Validation check format save = TRUE, data frame saved corresponding folder (default TRUE) peek hood, let’s run whole processing function . need process NDOH file full import file. run ndoh_processing(), function automatically save import file validation file data-raw/Import Files data-raw/Validation Files folders respectively. may also want break import file partner partner DQRT. , can use function partner_import() tierdrop package. function run, partner import files get automatically saved data-raw/Import Files folder. Et voila! TIER import file format DATIM. file can used engage following steps MER processing: Send TIER Import files partners Run TIER DQRT partner level file Consolidate non-TIER partner files Submit whole import file DATIM
code: df_import <- ndoh_processing(filepath = ndoh_filepath, qtr = "Q3", export_type = "Import", save= FALSE) #>  #> ---- IMPORT VALIDATION ---- #>  #> Are there facilities reported in NDOH that are not in the USAID MFL? #> v Reading from "USAID Mapping File (as of 8/31/2022)". #> v Range df_map_distinct. #> v Reading from "USAID Mapping File (as of 8/31/2022)". #> v Range df_map_distinct. #> v Reading from "USAID Mapping File (as of 8/31/2022)". #> v Range df_map_distinct. #> v Reading from "USAID Mapping File (as of 8/31/2022)". #> v Range df_map_distinct. #> v Reading from "USAID Mapping File (as of 8/31/2022)". #> v Range df_map_distinct. #>  #> ---- IMPORT VALIDATION ---- #>  #> Are there facilities reported in NDOH that are not in the USAID MFL? #> ec East London Maximum Correctional Centre #> ec East London Medium B Correctional Centre #> ec Mdantsane Correctional Centre #> gp Leeuwkop Medium A Correctional Centre #> gp Leeuwkop Medium C Correctional Centre #> gp Johannesburg Medium A Correctional Centre #> kz Ebongweni Maximum Correctional Centre #> kz Kokstad Medium Correctional Centre #> kz Qalakabusha Correctional Centre #> lp Polokwane Correctional Centre #> mp Nelspruit Correctional Centre #> mp Bethal Correctional Centre #> wc Goodwood Correctional Centre #> wc Pollsmoor Medium A Correctional Centre #> wc Pollsmoor Medium B Correctional Centre #> wc Pollsmoor Medium C Correctional Centre #> gp Johannesburg Medium C Correctional Centre #> kz Empangeni Correctional Centre #> gp Johannesburg Medium B Correctional Centre #> kz Eshowe Correctional Centre #> fs Odendaalsrus Correctional Centre #> gp Heidelberg Correctional Centre #> mp Ermelo Correctional Centre #> v Reading from "USAID Mapping File (as of 8/31/2022)". #> v Range df_map_distinct. #> v Reading from "USAID Mapping File (as of 8/31/2022)". #> v Range df_map_distinct. #> v Reading from "USAID Mapping File (as of 8/31/2022)". #> v Range df_map_distinct. #> v Reading from "USAID Mapping File (as of 8/31/2022)". #> v Range df_map_distinct. #> v Reading from "USAID Mapping File (as of 8/31/2022)". #> v Range df_map_distinct. df_validation <- ndoh_processing(filepath = ndoh_filepath, qtr = "Q3", export_type = "Validation", save= FALSE) #>  #> ---- IMPORT VALIDATION ---- #>  #> Are there facilities reported in NDOH that are not in the USAID MFL? #>  #>  #> ---- IMPORT VALIDATION ---- #>  #> Are there facilities reported in NDOH that are not in the USAID MFL? #> ec East London Maximum Correctional Centre #> ec East London Medium B Correctional Centre #> ec Mdantsane Correctional Centre #> gp Leeuwkop Medium A Correctional Centre #> gp Leeuwkop Medium C Correctional Centre #> gp Johannesburg Medium A Correctional Centre #> kz Ebongweni Maximum Correctional Centre #> kz Kokstad Medium Correctional Centre #> kz Qalakabusha Correctional Centre #> lp Polokwane Correctional Centre #> mp Nelspruit Correctional Centre #> mp Bethal Correctional Centre #> wc Goodwood Correctional Centre #> wc Pollsmoor Medium A Correctional Centre #> wc Pollsmoor Medium B Correctional Centre #> wc Pollsmoor Medium C Correctional Centre #> gp Johannesburg Medium C Correctional Centre #> kz Empangeni Correctional Centre #> gp Johannesburg Medium B Correctional Centre #> kz Eshowe Correctional Centre #> fs Odendaalsrus Correctional Centre #> gp Heidelberg Correctional Centre #> mp Ermelo Correctional Centre Broadreach_import <- tierdrop::partner_import(df = df_import, 70287, save = FALSE) RTC_import <- tierdrop::partner_import(df = df_import, 70290, save = FALSE) ANOVA_import <- tierdrop::partner_import(df = df_import, 70310, save = FALSE) MATCH_import <- tierdrop::partner_import(df = df_import, 81902, save = FALSE) WRHI_import <- tierdrop::partner_import(df = df_import, 70301, save = FALSE)

what: TierDrop: Data Processing, Consolidation, and Verification for USAID/South Africa MER DATIM Reporting
title: TierDrop: Data Processing, Consolidation, and Verification for USAID/South Africa MER DATIM Reporting
text: TierDrop package process, validate, consolidate MER data 2 primary data sources (TIER data National Department Health (NDoH) non-TIER data reported implementing partners) import DATIM USAID South Africa. package allow users tidy process data NDoH DATIM import file, consolidate TIER non-TIER files, run verification checks build Data Quality Reporting Trackers (DQRT).

title: TierDrop: Data Processing, Consolidation, and Verification for USAID/South Africa MER DATIM Reporting

Mapping DATIM UIDS to NDOH tab structure — map_disaggs
text: df NDOH dataset map DATIM hierachy ind_sel Selected indicators map - default "" indicators, removes PrEP_CT TX_RTT must mapped separately ("", "PrEP_CT", "TX_RTT") disaggregate Selected disaggregate group map - default indicators (minus PrEP_CT & TX_RTT) .e. PrEP_CT Disaggs: (1) "Age/Sex" (2) "TestResult", TX_RTT Disaggs: (1) "Age/Sex/HIVStatus" (2) "ARTNoContactReasonIIT all_indic TRUE data indicators (minus PrEP_CT TX_RTT) mapped, FALSE

title: Mapping DATIM UIDS to NDOH tab structure — map_disaggs
code: if (FALSE) {    map_disaggs(df = ndoh_clean, ind_sel = "PrEP_CT", disaggregate ="Age/Sex", all_indic = FALSE)    map_disaggs(df = ndoh_clean, all_indic = TRUE) }

what: Wrapper function to process NDOH data — ndoh_wrapper
title: Wrapper function to process NDOH data — ndoh_wrapper
text: function wraps together functions import NDOH file append indicator tabs (import_ndoh()), checks facility alignment NDOH MFL (validate_ndoh()), tidies dataframe cleans indicator names (tidy_ndoh()), finally maps dataElement categoryOptionCombo information using map_disaggs() ndoh_post_processing()
